medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient describes her pain as cramping, located over the epigastrium and left upper quadrant, non-radiating, which has progressively worsened over the days. She also endorses intermittent nausea, multiple episodes of non-bloody, non-bilious emesis, loose bowel movements, and poor appetite.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, hypothyroidism, hypercholesterolemia, GERD, sickle-cell trait, right carpal and cubital tunnel syndrome, uterine prolapse, colonic adenoma.
medical_history.family_history: No history of inflammatory bowel disease or GI malignancies.
